Home

Locus Temporarius is an example website built with totem.

Things To Do Here

Click on links. Follow them. Explore the site.

If you want to know why something is styled the way it is, take a look at the file _style/style.css and make changes if desired.

Pay special attention to the following CSS:

section, section:target ~ #home, #home:has(~ section:target) { display: none; } #home, section:target { display: block; }

This is what allows the site to show/hide pages based on what the user has selected. Removing it may lead to unintended site behavior.

Inline Footnotes and External Links

Posted on 2025/10/30

You can use inline footnotes to hide information from the reader unless they click on the little footnote superscript indicator. They look like this. Now you can read this information. Click the indicator again to hide it.

You can use footnotes to stow away extra text, or any arbitrary HTML you want to throw in there as well.

A Note About External Links

If you include links to external sites in your website, then totem will expect you to "mark" them as external. What you should do is the following:

<a href="https://example.com">Link Text</a>

Should become:

<a { EXT_LINK } href="https://example.com">Link Text</a>

Except, you don't want those spaces between the curly braces ({,}) and the EXT_LINK. I'm just doing that here otherwise it will get replaced when I render this post.

During the build process, that marker will be replaced with target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" which guarantees that the link will open in a new tab instead of the current one.

You can test it out by following this link.

NOTE: If you forget to include the EXT_LINK marker, totem will complain about that specific link during the build process, so you can go find it and add the EXT_LINK marker.

On Images in Blog Posts

Posted on 2025/09/08

You can include images in blog posts, either on their own, or within a figure tag so that you can include a caption.

A Note About Lazy Images

In order to make loading the site easier, totem will automatically add the loading="lazy" attribute to all images it comes across during the build process.

The First Blog Post

Posted on 2025/08/23

This is the first blog post. You can put whatever content you want in here.

  • Paragraphs of text
  • Lists of various items
  • Images with captions
  • Inline footnotes
  • Whatever else you feel like

Take a look at other blog posts and you'll see examples of the things listed above.

A Note About Filenames

totem expects the blog post filenames to be in a specific format. It uses this format to determine what the associated title and date of the post is. The format is as follows:

YYYY-MM-DD Arbitrary Post Title.html

In plain English, the filename must start with a date in YYY-MM-DD format, such as 2024-06-12, then contain a space, then you can use whatever title you want.
